intro: Parahellenia, commonly known as the Mediterranean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Parahellenia has lance-shaped leaves and produces showy blooms from late spring to early summer. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
